perturbation.original_text: Excite will in "good faith" ensure Client that the above mentioned banners and promotional placements will be more prominently presented than any other "competitive retailer's" banners or promotional placements for the term of the Agreement. For the purposes of this Agreement, a "competitive retailer" means an on-line department store comparable to Bloomingdale's, Macy's, Burdine's, Shopping.com, Chef's Catalog or iQVC.
perturbation.changed_text: Excite will use reasonable efforts to ensure Client that the above mentioned banners and promotional placements will be prominently presented. For the purposes of this Agreement, a "competitive retailer" may include retailers at Excite's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: Changing "good faith ensure" to "use reasonable efforts" weakens the obligation. The change in the definition of "competitive retailer" gives Excite too much discretion, potentially harming the client. This introduces ambiguity and makes the obligation less enforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract law; failure of good faith and fair dealing under New York law (as per Section 16(b)).

perturbation.original_text: Client will provide to Excite all User Data collected by Client within thirty (30) days following the end of each calendar month during the term of this Agreement in a mutually-determined electronic format.
perturbation.changed_text: Client will endeavor to provide Excite with User Data collected by Client in a timely manner in a format that is convenient.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing "will provide" with "will endeavor to provide" makes the provision of user data non-mandatory. Removing the 30-day deadline and "mutually-determined electronic format" introduces significant vagueness, allowing Client to potentially delay or withhold User Data.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract law; hinders Excite's ability to enforce data sharing under the agreement, which could be viewed as a failure to perform a material obligation. California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), if the lack of data impacts Excite's ability to comply with consumer data requests.

perturbation.original_text:
Client will indemnify, defend and hold harmless Excite, its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, consultants and agents from any and all third party claims, liability, damages and/or costs (including, but not limited to, attorneys fees) arising from:

                  i)    The breach of any representation or covenant in this                         Agreement; or

                  ii)   Any claim that Client's advertising banners infringe or                         violate any third party's copyright, patent, trade                         secret, trademark, right of publicity or right of                         privacy or contain any defamatory content; or

                  iii)  Any claim arising from content displayed on the Client                         Site.

            Excite will promptly notify Client of any and all such claims and             will reasonably cooperate with Client with the defense and/or             settlement thereof; provided that, if any settlement requires an             affirmative obligation of, results in any ongoing liability to or             prejudices or detrimentally impacts Excite in any way and such             obligation, liability, prejudice or impact can reasonably be             expected to be material, then such settlement shall require Excite's             written consent (not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed) and             Excite may have its own counsel in attendance at all proceedings and             substantive negotiations relating to such claim.
perturbation.changed_text: Client may indemnify Excite, its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, consultants and agents from third-party claims at Client's discretion. Excite will attempt to notify Client of such claims and may cooperate with Client.
perturbation.explanation: Changing "will indemnify, defend and hold harmless" to "may indemnify...at Client's discretion" entirely weakens Client's indemnification obligation, making it optional. Replacing "will promptly notify" with "will attempt to notify" and "will reasonably cooperate" with "may cooperate" further reduces Excite's protection, creating significant ambiguity and making the indemnification clause nearly unenforceable. This contradicts the basic principle of contractual indemnification.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract law; specifically invalidates the indemnification clause, rendering it ineffective and leaving Excite without its bargained-for protection. The contract refers to New York Law in 16(b) and this change would be a failure of good faith and fair dealing.
